pageContext.claim: “'We've never seen this before. A man who's campaigning on the fact that he's going to raise your taxes, I haven't seen.”
pageContext.analysis: Biden is not the first presidential nominee seeking to raise taxes. As Tax Policy Center noted, in 1984, Walter Mondale memorably said, “Mr. Reagan will raise taxes, and so will I. He won't tell you. I just did.” Obama also promised to raise some taxes on those making more than $200,000 per year. In Biden's case, contrary to Trump's rhetoric, he says he would limit the tax increases to people making more than $400,000 a year.
